backend_import_fix.notes: Endpoint now imports parse_all_decisions and JudgeDecision from cube.core.decision_parser; read_decision_file is no longer referenced.

backend_functionality.notes: parse_all_decisions(task_id) is invoked inside a try/except, empty results trigger a 404, and we verified the module import succeeds without raising ImportError.

frontend_preserved.notes: No frontend files changed during synthesis; existing Decisions UI, components, and types remain intact.

code_quality.notes: Only tasks.py was touched, helper functions serialize JudgeDecision cleanly, and the response shape stays type-safe for the current frontend.

response_format.notes: Endpoint responds with {"decisions": [...]}; each decision includes type, judges, timestamp, and optional winner to match the UI expectations.

changes_made: Replaced read_decision_file usage with parse_all_decisions from cube.core.decision_parser
Added _build_decision_payload helper to convert JudgeDecision dataclasses into JSON-friendly structures
Serialized judge vote metadata using JUDGE_MODELS for consistent model labels
synthesis_compliance.notes: Original ImportError is eliminated; backend now relies on the available decision_parser utilities.

strengths_confirmed: Rich Decisions page layout with consensus metrics, responsive vote grid, and synthesis section remains untouched
TypeScript unions for vote types and AbortController-based fetch handling continue to enforce correctness
JudgeVote component still provides readable, color-coded cards aligned with Tailwind styling guidance
summary: The synthesis fix correctly swaps in parse_all_decisions, wraps the result in a JSON payload the frontend already understands, and preserves the excellent UI work. With the ImportError resolved and no regressions found, the feature is production-ready.
next_steps: Announce availability of the Decisions UI endpoint to the frontend team
